form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Hagan (for herself and Mrs. Gillibrand) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide for the payment of monthly annuities under the Survivor Benefit Plan to a supplemental or special needs trust established for the sole benefit of a disabled dependent child of a participant in the Survivor Benefit Plan.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Disabled Military Child Protection Act of 2013.

section.header: Survivor Benefit Plan annuities for special needs trusts established for the benefit of dependent children incapable of self-support

subsection.header: Special needs trust as eligible beneficiary

paragraph.text: Subsection (a) of section 1450 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following new paragraph (4):

paragraph.header: Special needs trusts for sole benefit of certain dependent children
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (i), a supplemental or special needs trust described in subparagraph (A) or (C) of section 1917(d)(4) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396p(d)(4)) that is established for the sole benefit of a dependent child considered disabled under section 1614(a)(3) of that Act (42 U.S.C. 1382c(a)(3)) who is incapable of self-support because of mental or physical incapacity.
Subsection (i) of such section is amended by inserting (a)(4) or after subsection.

subsection.text: Section 1455(d) of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking and fiduciaries and inserting , fiduciaries, and special needs trusts;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and at the end;
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

a dependent child incapable of self-support because of mental or physical incapacity for whom a supplemental or special needs trust, as described in subparagraph (A) or (C) of section 1917(d)(4) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396p(d)(4)), has been established.
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following new subparagraph (C):
In the case of an annuitant referred to in paragraph (1)(C), payment of the annuity to the supplemental or special needs trust established for the annuitant.
in subparagraph (D), as redesignated, by striking subparagraphs (D) and (E) and inserting subparagraphs (E) and (F); and

clause.text: in clause (i), by striking and at the end;
by adding at the end the following new clause:
procedures for determining when annuity payments to a supplemental or special needs trust shall end based on the death or marriage of the dependent child for which the trust was established.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking to guardian or fiduciary in the paragraph heading.
